body_html:
Alas, it is not currently possible to get bazel to build a single .a file that you can link against the C++ API. For details see bazelbuild/bazel#1920

Till that is resolved, the alternatives are either:

  • Build the shared library (bazel build -c opt //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so) and link against and run with that available, OR
  • Figure out a way to get the static library built using the Makefile (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile)

Our hope is that the bazel team will be able to figure out a solution and we can then add those targets.

Closing this issue since I believe the original query has been answered. Feel free to re-open or ping if you think closing it was a mistake. Thanks!

body:
Alas, it is not currently possible to get bazel to build a single `.a` file that you can link against the C++ API. For details see https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/1920 

Till that is resolved, the alternatives are either:
- Build the shared library (`bazel build -c opt //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so`) and link against and run with that available, OR
- Figure out a way to get the static library built using the Makefile (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile)

Our hope is that the bazel team will be able to figure out a solution and we can then add those targets.

Closing this issue since I believe the original query has been answered. Feel free to re-open or ping if you think closing it was a mistake. Thanks!
